abstracts.cdata!:
This results profile talks about
            improving access to and quality of health services in
            Lesotho.  Lesotho’s challenges in the healthcare sector are
            daunting and battling: the world’s third highest HIV/AIDS
            prevalence rate, life expectancy of 45 years, and demand
            that consistently outstrips the state’s ability to provide
            vital health care services. The Health Sector Reform Program
            has successfully helped the country improve essential health
            care services for the poor through improved antenatal care,
            reduced hospital waiting time, a higher tuberculosis cure
            rate, and expanded access to services preventing
            mother-to-child transmission of HIV/AIDS.
